event: Became a Teaching Assistant for Discrete Structures at Northeastern University
description: Following taking the class, I took the opportunity to lead weekly recitations (small, focused lectures) in addition to grading and tutoring.

event: Entered at Northeastern University as an Undeclared Engineering Honors Student
description: I went into undergraduate with the intent of pursuing a career in patent law, by first developing a background in engineering. I quickly decided to study Computer Engineering and Computer Science.

Ranked 5th / approx. 300, as an AP Scholar with Distinction, with an unweighted GPA of 3.92. I was also president of the National Honors Society, captain of the MBA Mock Trial Team, president of the Junior State of America chapter, member of the Tri-M Music Honors Society, member of the Central District MMEA choir (baritone), varsity tennis player, theater member, and pinchaser.

event: Started at PINZ Entertainment as a "Pinchaser" (Bowling Mechanic)
description: I joined the gaming staff at my local bowling alley, and became an experienced bowling mechanic over college summers, fixing the pinspotters, laser tag systems, and arcade machines. I bowled a 216 once and retired.

event: Started at Five Guys Burgers and Fries as a Crew Member
description: Got my first job as a cashier and line cook, learning how to grill the meanest burger west of I-495.
